ko: 헬렌 켈러는 보지도 듣지도 말하지도 못했어.

en: The Berlin Wall fell in 1989.
Belgium is not as big as France.
Belgium is not as large as France.
As soon as she heard the bell ring, she answered the telephone.
ko: 벨 소리 듣자마자 그 여자는 전화를 받았어.

en: She answered the telephone as soon as she heard the bell ring.
ko: 그 여자는 벨 소리 듣자마자 바로 전화를 받았어.

en: As soon as the bell rang the teacher came into the classroom.
Immediately after the bell rang the teacher came into the classroom.
ko: 벨이 울리자마자 바로 선생님이 교실에 들어오셨어.

en: Have you ever been to Venice?
Betty didn't say a word.
Betty managed to sing well.
The headlights don't work.
Beth told Chris that if he didn't take a bath, she wouldn't go on a date with him.
ko: 베스는 크리스한테 안 씻으면 데이트 안 하겠다고 말했어.

en: Beth told Chris that if he didn't take a bath, she wouldn't go out with him.
ko: 베스는 크리스한테 목욕 안 하면 같이 안 나갈 거라고 했어.

en: Did you hear that Fred was dismissed?
The brakes didn't work.
It seems that Mr. Brooke is an honest person.
ko: 브룩 씨는 정직한 사람인 것 같아.

en: The girl in the blue coat is my daughter.
ko: 파란색 코트 입은 여자애가 제 딸이에요.

en: The girl wearing the blue coat is my daughter.
ko: 파란색 코트 입고 있는 애가 우리 딸이에요.

en: We have a daughter who is married to a Frenchman.
ko: 프랑스 사람이랑 결혼한 딸이 한 명 있어요.

en: Speaking French is difficult.
French is her native language.
French is her first language.
This book is difficult to read as it is written in French.
ko: 이 책은 프랑스어로 써 있어서 읽기 힘들어요.

en: The French were defeated at Waterloo.
Please put me through to Mr. Black.
Is there any chance that Mr. Black will agree to the plan?
ko: 블랙 씨가 그 계획에 찬성할 가능성이 있을까요?

en: A plastic cup is better than one made of real glass.
Mr. Brown is in charge of our class.
Mr. Brown is looking for his glasses.
Mr. Brown is our English teacher.
Mr. Brown always carries a book with him.
ko: 브라운 씨는 항상 책을 들고 다녀요.

en: Please put me through to Mr. Brown.
Mr. Brown gave me your name.
I'd like you to meet Mr. Brown.
Let me introduce you to Mr. Brown.
Mr. Brown is a wool merchant.
Mr. Brown has a magical way with children.
ko: 브라운 씨는 아이들을 다루는 특별한 재주가 있어요.

en: Please give me the number for Mr. Brown.
Mr. Brown has four children.
A Mr. Brown wants you on the phone.
There's a telephone call from a person named Brown.
I think he's Mr. Brown.
ko: 저 사람이 브라운 씨인 것 같아요.

en: Brian left heading for New York.
Brian bought some lipstick for Kate.
Gaining too much weight is not good for your health.
ko: 살이 너무 찌는 건 건강에 안 좋아요.

en: I'll beat you up!
I'll kick your butt!
I'll slap the living daylights out of you!
I'll smack the living daylights out of you!
The football game is now being broadcast.
They were supposed to have gotten married in May.
They were supposed to have gotten married in May, but they didn't.
Mr. Fujimori is famous all over the world.
Owls can see in the dark.
Mr. Ford is all right now.
Mr. Ford is what is called a self-made man.
I forgot to phone Mr. Ford.
I forgot to call Mr. Ford up.
ko: 포드 씨한테 전화 거는 걸 잊어버렸어요.

en: I forgot to call Mr. Ford.
Mr. Ford owns this land.
Show me where Puerto Rico is on the map.
At most, there were only 100 passengers on the ferry.
She lost her locker key while she was swimming in the pool.
ko: 그 여자는 수영장에서 수영하다가 사물함 열쇠를 잃어버렸대요.

en: I lost my film.
Go for it!
Ping pong is also called table tennis.
You could've heard a pin drop.
ko: 바늘 떨어지는 소리도 들릴 정도로 조용했어.

en: Hiromi is wearing a new dress.
Bill often breaks his promises.
Bill often doesn't keep his promises.
Bill doesn't like the fact that his father smokes a lot.
ko: 빌은 아빠가 담배를 많이 피우시는 걸 안 좋아해.

en: Bill hates that his father smokes heavily.
ko: 빌은 아빠가 담배를 너무 많이 피우는 걸 싫어해.

en: Bill can speak a little Japanese.
ko: 빌은 일본어를 조금 할 줄 알아.

en: Bill speaks a little Japanese.
Bill did not say that she should obey him no matter what.
ko: 빌은 그녀가 무슨 일이 있어도 자기 말을 들어야 한다고 말하지 않았어.

en: Bill is two years older than I am.
Bill is not as tall as you.
It's astonishing how fluently Bill spoke Japanese.
ko: 빌이 일본어를 너무 유창하게 해서 깜짝 놀랐어.

en: Bill got up early in order to catch the first train.
Bill got up early so he could catch the first train.
Bill can run the fastest in his class.
Bill is always honest.
Bill is the smarter of the two brothers.
ko: 빌이 형제 둘 중에 더 똑똑해.

en: Bill goes fishing every other day.
ko: 빌은 이틀에 한 번씩 낚시하러 가.

en: When Mr. Hilton wanted to sell his house, he advertised it in the newspaper.
ko: 힐튼 씨는 집을 팔려고 신문에 광고를 냈어.

en: Bill and John like to get together once a month to talk.
ko: 빌이랑 존은 한 달에 한 번 만나서 얘기하는 걸 좋아해.

en: Bill and John like to get together once a month to chat.
ko: 빌이랑 존은 한 달에 한 번 만나서 수다 떠는 걸 좋아해.

en: Bill, have you taken Spot for a walk yet?
John might know something about Mr. Black.
ko: 존은 블랙 씨에 대해서 뭔가 알지도 몰라.

en: She might possibly know the answer.
There's a chance that she might know the answer.
It might rain. We should take an umbrella.
Hunger is the best spice.
Let's take a coffee break.
You should've told me that you wanted me to come alone.
ko: 혼자 오길 원했다고 미리 말해주지 그랬어.

en: I have an opinion.
It's very cold.
My head aches so.
My head really aches.
I had a terrible experience.
You'll have a rough time.
You'll find yourself in a miserable situation.
I had a terrible stomachache.
I had a bad stomachache.
Since he had a bad cold, he was absent from school today.
ko: 걔는 심한 감기 때문에 오늘 학교 결석했어.

en: I haven't got rid of my bad cold yet.
I haven't gotten rid of my bad cold yet.
I haven't gotten over my bad cold yet.
I have a terrible pain.
We couldn't go out because of the snowstorm.
It'll be impossible to get a visa on short notice.
ko: 갑자기 비자를 받는 건 불가능할 거야.

en: Let's decide on the date for the picnic.
I've quit drinking beer.
How about a beer?
Could I please have one more can of beer?
ko: 맥주 한 캔만 더 줄 수 있어?

en: Don't drink so much beer.
I don't drink a lot of beer.
Do you have any beer?
Do you have beer?
Who's the man playing the piano?
ko: 피아노 치고 있는 저 남자 누구야?

en: Pianos are very expensive, aren't they?
Pianos are really expensive, aren't they?
Pianos are quite expensive, aren't they?
Wow! Pianos are expensive.
I never dreamed that I would take first place in the piano contest.
ko: 피아노 콩쿠르에서 1등 할 줄은 꿈에도 몰랐어.

en: As a pianist, he's much better than I am.
ko: 피아니스트로서 그 사람은 나보다 훨씬 잘해.

en: I ordered two hamburgers.
The price of bread rose by ten yen.
Mr. Hunt is the principal of our school.
ko: 헌트 씨는 우리 학교 교장 선생님이야.

en: Please give me a Band-Aid and some medicine.
The hunter hunted rabbits with his dog.
ko: 사냥꾼은 자기 개랑 같이 토끼 사냥을 했어.

en: In Hawaii, we can enjoy swimming in the ocean all year round.
ko: 하와이에서는 일 년 내내 바다 수영을 즐길 수 있어.

en: Some people like volleyball, others enjoy tennis.
ko: 배구를 좋아하는 사람도 있고, 테니스를 즐기는 사람도 있어.

en: It is 50 kilometers to Paris.
It's the shortest route to Paris.
Before going to work in Paris, I must brush up on my French.
ko: 파리로 일하러 가기 전에 프랑스어 공부 좀 다시 해야겠어.

en: Before going to study in Paris, I must brush up on my French.
ko: 파리로 공부하러 가기 전에 프랑스어 공부 좀 다시 해야겠어.

en: I was having thoughts that made my blood boil.
ko: 피가 거꾸로 솟을 만큼 화나는 생각을 하고 있었어.

en: Roses have thorns on their stems.
There's nothing I like as much as the smell of roses.
If only I'd sold that property before the economic bubble burst I wouldn't have lost all that money.
ko: 거품 경제가 무너지기 전에 그 부동산을 팔았어야 했는데, 그랬으면 그 돈을 다 날리지는 않았을 거야.

en: Daddy, may I go out and play?
The dove symbolizes peace.
Patty was so short that she couldn't reach the branch.
ko: 패티는 키가 너무 작아서 나뭇가지에 손이 안 닿았어.

en: The battery is flat.
Someone stole my bag.
Speak clearly.
Say it clearly.
Personal computers are very useful.
Only she can use the computer.
ko: 그 컴퓨터는 걔만 쓸 수 있어.

en: Where is the bus stop?
I met some friends while I was waiting for a bus.
I met a friend while I was waiting for a bus.
My passport was stolen.
The bus arrived ten minutes late.
The bus stopped to pick up passengers.
I ran into a friend of mine on the bus.
ko: 버스에서 내 친구 한 명을 우연히 만났어.

en: I ran into a friend on the bus.
I ran into Mr. Lynch on the bus.
Get on the bus.
I may have left my umbrella on the bus.
ko: 버스에 우산을 두고 내린 것 같아.

en: Let's hurry so we can catch the bus.
Fifty people can ride on the bus.
I left my briefcase on the bus.
An old man sat next to me on the bus.
ko: 버스에서 어떤 할아버지가 내 옆에 앉으셨어.

en: Do you plan to go to Tokyo by bus?
Let's go by bus.
It takes two hours to get there by bus.
ko: 버스로 거기까지 가는 데 두 시간 걸려.

en: It'll take two hours to get there by bus.
ko: 버스로 거기까지 가는 데 두 시간 걸릴 거야.

en: About how long will it take to get there by bus?
ko: 버스 타고 거기까지 대충 얼마나 걸려?

en: There is only one bath towel.
Playing basketball is fun.
There were many rotten apples in the basket.
Since the bus was late, I took a taxi.
I took a taxi because the bus was late.
Since the bus was late, we had to wait in the rain a long time.
ko: 버스가 늦게 와서 빗속에서 한참 기다려야 했어.

en: Put on your pajamas.
I ate breakfast in my pajamas.
Nice to meet you, Mrs Jones.
At first, I mistook him for your brother.
ko: 처음엔 걔가 네 형인 줄 알았어.

en: At first, I thought he was your brother.
ko: 처음엔 걔가 네 형인 줄 알았어.

en: There's almost no water in the bucket.
There's hardly any water in the bucket.
Stop your nonsense.
Yes, I know it.
Would you like another piece of pie?
We should cancel the hike.
We'd better cancel the hike.
It's said that the Vikings discovered America before Columbus did.
They say that the Vikings discovered America before Columbus.
Who's the man playing the violin?
ko: 바이올린 켜고 있는 저 남자 누구야?

en: Yes. Tony had it.
We've arrived.
"Have you eaten?" "Yes, I have."
Yes, we can go.
Yes, she'll probably come home.
ko: 응, 걔 아마 집에 올 거야.

en: No, I didn't go out.
I answered, "Yes, I want it."
Do you agree with Mr. Burns or do you agree with Mr. Roland?
ko: 번스 씨 의견에 동의해, 아니면 롤랜드 씨 의견에 동의해?

en: Who do you agree with, Mr. Burns or Mr. Roland?
ko: 번스 씨랑 롤랜드 씨 중에 누구 의견에 동의해?

en: A permanent costs extra.
Let's start the party.
The party was a great success.
The party's over.
The party was fun. You should've come, too.
The party was really fun.
The party was held on May 22nd.
I'd like to attend the party.
Though I've decided to go to the party, I'm not looking forward to it.
ko: 파티에 가기로 했지만, 별로 기대되진 않아.

en: Everybody at the party was charmed by her elegance.
ko: 파티에 있던 모든 사람이 그녀의 우아함에 반했어.

en: What was served in the party?
I love parties.
Mr. Parker tried eating with chopsticks.
ko: 파커 씨는 젓가락으로 먹어 보려고 했어.

en: I can't stand this noise anymore.
ko: 이 소음 더 이상 못 참겠어.

en: I can't bear this noise anymore.
The Norman victory over England had a big impact on the English language.
ko: 노르만족의 영국 정복은 영어에 큰 영향을 미쳤어.

en: In countries such as Norway and Finland, they have lots of snow in the winter.
ko: 노르웨이나 핀란드 같은 나라들은 겨울에 눈이 정말 많이 와요.

en: In countries like Norway and Finland, they have lots of snow in the winter.
ko: 노르웨이랑 핀란드 같은 곳은 겨울에 눈이 많이 내려요.

en: Mr. Norton is pleasant to work with.
ko: 노턴 씨는 같이 일하기 참 좋은 분이에요.

en: One mouse is running around in the room.
ko: 쥐 한 마리가 방 안에서 돌아다니고 있어요.

en: A mouse is running around the room.
ko: 쥐 한 마리가 방 안을 뛰어다녀요.

en: Hey, don't go.
Wet clothes stick to your skin.
New York is the world's biggest city.
You can go from Washington to New York by train.
ko: 워싱턴에서 뉴욕까지 기차로 갈 수 있어요.

en: You can get from Washington to New York by train.
ko: 워싱턴에서 뉴욕까지 기차 타고 가면 돼요.

en: The pride of New York is its museums.
Mr. Newman often comes to Japan.
Doraemon smiles often.
There's no need for Nick to come to my office.
ko: 닉이 굳이 제 사무실까지 올 필요는 없어요.

en: I must ask Nick for his new address and telephone number when I see him.
ko: 닉을 만나면 새 주소랑 전화번호를 꼭 물어봐야겠어요.

en: For one reason or another, their holiday in France wasn't as good as they expected it would be.
ko: 이런저런 이유로 그들의 프랑스 휴가는 기대했던 것만큼 좋지는 않았대요.

en: What a strong wind!
Why do I have to do this?
Why do I have to do it?
What a big dog!
What a strange story!
I really am unlucky!
What a beautiful sunset.
This is really delicious soup, isn't it?
This soup tastes really great.
Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.
ko: 네 이웃을 네 몸과 같이 사랑하라.

en: Nancy seldom smiles.
Nancy wouldn't do a stupid thing like getting married to Jack.
ko: 낸시가 잭이랑 결혼하는 그런 바보 같은 짓을 할 리가 없어요.

en: Nancy and Jane had to go back home at five thirty.
ko: 낸시랑 제인은 5시 반에 집에 가야 했어요.

en: Indeed she is not beautiful, but she is good-natured.
ko: 확실히 예쁘지는 않지만 성격은 참 좋아요.

en: From his accent, I would guess that man is Scottish.
ko: 말투를 들어보니 저 남자 스코틀랜드 사람인가 봐요.

en: What will you make?
What do you make?
The fact that I said nothing made him angry.
ko: 내가 아무 말도 안 한 게 그 사람을 화나게 했나 봐요.

en: Has anything changed?
Is there anything strange?
Nathanael asked Jesus, "How do you know me?"
Why do we dream?
Why did she need to send for him?
ko: 왜 그 여자가 그를 오라고 사람을 보내야 했나요?

en: Why didn't she come yesterday?
ko: 어제 그 여자는 왜 안 왔어요?

en: Why does she look so sad?
ko: 그 여자 왜 그렇게 슬퍼 보여요?

en: I can't tell you why she was absent from school.
ko: 그 여자가 왜 학교에 결석했는지 말해줄 수 없어요.

en: Why does he look grumpy?
ko: 그 사람 왜 이렇게 뾰루퉁해 보여요?

en: Why does he look so black?
ko: 그 사람 왜 그렇게 표정이 어두워요?

en: Why did he quit smoking?
Why did you turn down his request for a pay raise?
ko: 왜 그 사람 연봉 인상 요구를 거절했나요?

en: I think that why he killed his wife is a mystery.
ko: 그가 왜 아내를 죽였는지는 미스터리인 것 같아요.

en: I think the reason why he killed his wife is still a mystery.
ko: 그가 아내를 살해한 이유가 아직 베일에 싸여 있는 것 같아요.

en: Can you make out why he won't go with us?
ko: 그가 왜 우리랑 같이 안 가려는지 알겠어요?

en: Why did I do that?
Why do I have to work overtime?
What made you decide to come here now?
ko: 왜 이제야 여기 오기로 한 거야?

en: Why did you come here?
It's difficult to understand why you want to go.
ko: 네가 왜 가고 싶어 하는지 이해하기 힘들어.

en: I wonder why.
The reason is that she is a wonderful teacher.
ko: 그 선생님이 정말 좋은 분이라서 그래.

en: The reason is, no one can speak my language.
ko: 내 말을 할 줄 아는 사람이 아무도 없어서 그래.

en: This is because there is nothing so beautiful that, even on close inspection, no defects will be found.
ko: 아무리 아름다운 거라도 자세히 들여다보면 결점이 없는 건 없기 때문이야.

en: I asked him why he is so sad.
Why did you do that?
Why did you go there?
Why did this happen?
Why did you lend money to someone like him?
Why did you lend money to someone like her?
Pears are canned in this factory.
He took what little money I had.
ko: 걔가 내 얼마 안 되는 돈을 다 가져갔어.

en: That's pretty good.
Please repair this.
Please fix it.
Please correct it.
The Nile River is the longest in the world.
You should be careful with knives.
There's no knife.
There are no knives.
Mr. Thompson has been very busy today.
No matter how you do it, the results will be the same.
What kind of meal did you eat?
What kind of places do you like?
What kind of flowers do you like?
What kind of fruit do you like best?
What's your favorite kind of fruit?
I'll win using whatever means it takes.
ko: 수단과 방법을 가리지 않고 이길 거야.

en: Any child knows that.
No matter what the cost, I will accomplish that.
ko: 어떤 대가를 치르더라도 그걸 해내고 말 거야.

en: I will accomplish that no matter what the cost.
ko: 무슨 수를 써서라도 그걸 해낼 거야.

en: I just don't like any kind of sports.
No matter how sleepy you are, brush your teeth.
No matter how busy you are, you have to do your homework.
No matter how tired I might be, I have to work.
No matter how tired I am, I have to work.
No matter how tired you are, you have to do it.
No matter how tired you might be, you have to do it.
No matter how old you are, it is still possible to learn.
ko: 나이가 아무리 많아도 배울 수 있어.

en: No matter how fast you run, you won't be in time.
ko: 아무리 빨리 뛰어도 제시간에 못 가.

en: I'd rather have a room of my own, no matter how small it is.
ko: 아무리 좁아도 내 방이 따로 있으면 좋겠어.

en: I want to get that classic car no matter how expensive it is.
ko: 아무리 비싸도 그 클래식 카는 꼭 갖고 싶어.

en: I'll buy that old clock no matter how expensive it is.
ko: 아무리 비싸도 그 오래된 시계는 살 거야.

en: No matter how hard I try, I will never be able to catch up with him.
ko: 아무리 노력해도 걔는 절대 못 따라잡을 거야.

en: No matter how hard I try, I can't do it any better than she can.

en: At any time in history, in any country you can think of, a child grows up borrowing from parents' values. There are some who would point out that the kind of mentality towards education that some women called "education mama" have, is actually emotionally scarring for the child.
ko: 역사상 어느 시대, 어느 나라에서든 아이는 부모의 가치관을 배우며 자라나. 어떤 이들은 소위 '교육 마마'라고 불리는 엄마들의 교육 방식이 아이에게 정서적으로 상처를 준다고 지적하기도 해.
